Permanent

Location:

Brief:
Our client in the Gauteng area in need of a Group CSI Officer.
Detail:
Role looking after the community service initiatives for the business.

Responsibilities:
* Community driven projects are managed and also followed up, charity events, hospice clinic management and drive, managing the various charity organization donations and support functions

Requirements:

* Should be flexible and willing to travel
* Must have a valid driver's license and own reliable transport.

Reporting structure:
* The role will be reporting to into the IT Directors as the function's leader within the Head Office function
For more information please contact:
Yolanda Day-Garden

Job Title:

Senior Payroll Administrator

Start Date:
2023-09-21 - 2023-10-21
Vacancy Type:
Permanent
RTB002280
Sectors:
Finance
Location:
Gauteng, JHB - Central
Salary:
R 25 000 - R 30 000.00 neg
Brief:
Senior Payroll Administrator needed within the Gauteng area, with previous working experience.
Detail:
Key responsibilities:
* Understand the importance of revenue, productively, chargeability and the employees pay and ensuring accuracy in processing of the payrolls with HR administrators and financial support.
* Supervise and execute routine admin activities (monthly) with accurate data and payroll capturing workflow leave management, benefit admin, and other payroll related duties.
* Process monthly and yearly calendar of payroll processing
* Computer hours worked
* Process all changes to payroll
* Ensure all payments are completed
* Provide new employees with nessecary training on the payroll system 
Technical Expertise:
* Liaise with tax authorities
* Use specific software programs (payroll system)
Team based
Responsibilities.
* Inputting payroll onto system
* Support tax officer 
* Assists senior team members
Requirements:
* Person who is willing to get involved at the Store Level
* Experience leading and coordinate a payroll function withing the FMCG organization
* Understand the BCEA and LRA in relation to the sectoral determination Act 9, wholesale and retail sector, COIDA and Unemployment Act
* Minimum 5-10 years working experience on a payroll system related to Psiber or sages HR Premier System
* Excel skills is required
* Must have reliable transport
For more information please contact:
Yolanda Day-Garden

Job Title:

Project Engineer

Start Date:
2023-09-21 - 2023-10-21
Vacancy Type:
Permanent
RTB002283
Sectors:
Engineering & Technical
Mining
Location:
Gauteng, Krugersdorp
Salary:
R35 000 (Market related, Negotiable)
Brief:
Are you a dedicated and ambitious Engineer looking to make a significant impact in the field of Tailings Storage Facilities Construction? Our Client is seeking a talented and registered Candidate Engineer with the Engineering Council of South Africa (ECSA) to join their dynamic team immediately!
Detail:
Position: Project Engineer (Registered Candidate Engineer) Location: Various Project Sites (Flexibility to travel/work away from home)
Availability: Immediatetly 

Key Responsibilities:
  • Project Planning: Develop comprehensive project plans, timelines, and budgets.
  • Structural Design: Oversee the structural design and engineering aspects of Tailings Storage Facilities.
  • Resource Management: Efficiently allocate resources, including labor and equipment.
  • Project Management: Lead all project phases from initiation to completion.
  • Procurement: Manage procurement processes and vendor relationships.
  • Reporting: Generate detailed project reports for stakeholders and management.
  • Site Establishment: Ensure the effective setup and organization of project sites.
  • Client Liaison: Act as the primary point of contact for clients, maintaining strong relationships.
  • Director and Service Provider Interaction: Collaborate with directors and service providers to meet project goals.
Requirements:
  • Graduate or Diplomat Engineer with relevant qualifications.
  • Registration as a Candidate Engineer with ECSA is essential.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Familiarity with Civil 3D, AutoCAD, and other relevant engineering software.
  • Strong project management skills and experience.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Willingness to relocate to various project sites as required.
MUST BE ABLE TO START EMPLOYMENT ON THE 01st of Oct 02023

Benefits: 
Company Vehicle (conditions applicable)
Housing Allowance
Cellphone Allowance
Funeral Cover
Provident Fund and Medical allowance after completion of 3 months probation.
For more information please contact:
Rene

Job Title:

Procurement Superintendent – Commodities

Start Date:
2023-09-21 - 2023-10-21
Vacancy Type:
Permanent
RTB002281
Sectors:
Mining
Location:
Gauteng, Sandton
Salary:
(Market related)
Brief:
The purpose of this role is to develop and implement a procurement strategy for the assigned category of commodities, ensuring efficient and effective procurement processes while adhering to safety, health, environmental, and quality standards.
Detail:
Requirements:
Minimum Qualifications:
  • A degree or National Diploma in Commerce, Law, Engineering, or Supply Chain Management.
Experience:
  • A minimum of 6 years of relevant experience, with a preference for at least 2 years of managerial experience.
Responsibilities:
Safety, Health, Environment, and Quality (SHEQ):
  • Identify and assess risk exposures.
  • Apply risk mitigation and control measures.
  • Ensure SHEQ compliance within the Section.
  • Utilize the Integrated Management System (IMS) for SHEQ reporting.
People Management:
  • Cultivate an enabling work culture.
  • Maintain labor stability and minimize turnover.
  • Align labor complement with the budget.
  • Achieve HDSA/Female targets.
  • Manage performance against targets and competencies.
  • Implement Individual Development Plans (IDPs) linked to performance.
  • Conduct quarterly career discussions.
  • Enforce discipline and address issues such as absenteeism and misconduct.
  • Provide coaching and counseling to improve performance.
  • Conduct recruitment interviews.
Customer Relations:
  • Foster and enhance relationships with key stakeholders.
  • Ensure satisfaction among customers and suppliers.
  • Interact with customers to understand operational concerns.
  • Establish and maintain effective communication channels between customers and suppliers.
  • Resolve customer queries and complaints.
Business Processes:
Category Management:
  • Manage all procurement-related activities within the assigned commodity category.
  • Implement strategic sourcing initiatives to reduce Total Cost of Ownership.
  • Identify, implement, and maintain relevant commodity contracts.
  • Achieve targeted cost savings through effective vendor negotiation.
  • Develop and maintain expert knowledge of supply markets, competitors, and innovations.
  • Facilitate procurement change initiatives to enhance business performance.
Vendor Management:
  • Oversee vendor rationalization strategy within the assigned category.
  • Manage vendor selection, compliance, and performance.
Stakeholder Management:
  • Build strong relationships with both internal and external customers to enhance their experience.
Contract Management:
  • Manage all contracts within the assigned category throughout their lifecycle.
  • Handle terminations, renewals, extensions, and re-assignments.
  • Identify and manage risks in collaboration with the cross-functional contracting team (Finance, Legal, Business Units, Maintenance Engineering).
Innovation:
  • Identify innovative procurement solutions that drive efficiency within the organization.
Management Support:
  • Conduct procurement analyses and reporting to assist management in tracking and achieving departmental targets.
  • Provide mentorship to Procurement Specialists and Contract Practitioners.
Growth:
  • Drive continuous improvement through operational excellence.
  • Identify opportunities for improvements within the Procurement pipeline.
  • Increase BEE (Black Economic Empowerment) spend.
  • Initiate Enterprise Development and Preferential Procurement opportunities.
Shareholder Value:
  • Manage the Section's costs.
  • Ensure compliance with Financial Policies and Procedures.
  • Protect company assets.
  • Reduce Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) and establish a competitive advantage through proactive procurement.
  • Deliver auditable benefits.
Behavioral Competencies:
  • Safety Leadership
  • Innovation
  • Leadership
  • Planning, Organizing & Control
  • Results Orientation
  • Problem Solving & Decision Making
  • Aligning Performance for Success
  • Communication
  • Change Leadership
  • Building Strong Teams
  • Business Acumen
Workplace Competencies:
  • Skills: Proficiency in Microsoft programs and Systems like IMS, EBMS, SAP, COUPA, MES
  • Knowledge: Understanding of legal contracts and Contract Management, market dynamics within the assigned commodity category, Supply Chain Management, Policies and Procedures, Systems Analysis, Mathematics, Mining Charter, B-BBEE Act, and the Code of Good Practice.
For more information please contact:
Rene

Apply

Job Title:

Program Manager

Start Date:
2023-09-21 - 2023-10-21
Vacancy Type:
Permanent
RTB002282
Sectors:
Mining
Location:
North West, Rustenburg
Salary:
(Market related, Negotiable)
Brief:
Our Client is seeking a suitably qualified Program Manager to join their Team
Detail:
Required Qualifications:
Relevant degree/diploma in Mechanical / Electrical Engineering/Technical/Construction discipline or equivalent.
Project Management Qualification (i.e. PMP or similar).
Working knowledge of Agile project management methodologies (such as Scrum, SAFe, Kanban, etc.) will be preferred.
 
Experience and Knowledge:            
10+ years’ experience in related field.
5+ years’ experience in a Project Management Role.
Minimum 5 years of experience in the following:
Engineering / Production / Construction / Mining / Process Plant and related operations environment.
Mining, Process Plant, Logistics, Infrastructure, Quantity Surveyor, Enterprise Project Management Systems, e.g. MS-Projects, Primavera P6, Prism, SAP.
Communicate Effectively: Speak, listen and write in a clear, thorough and timely manner using appropriate and effective communication tools and techniques.
Creativity/Innovation: Develop new and unique ways to improve operations of the organization and to create new opportunities.
Foster Teamwork: Work cooperatively and effectively with others to set goals, resolve problem, and make decisions that enhance organizational effectiveness.
The program manager must have strong practical experience in project management, which was gained through managing large and complex projects.
Good knowledge and handling of project and program management methodology and techniques.
 
Key Responsibilities:
Daily program management throughout the program life cycle.
Defining the program governance (controls).
Planning the overall program and monitoring the progress.
Managing the program’s budget.
Managing risks and issues and taking corrective measurements.
Coordinating the projects and their interdependencies.
Managing and utilizing resources across projects.
Managing stakeholders’ communication.
Aligning the deliverables (outputs) to the program’s “outcome” with the aid of the business change manager.
Managing the main program documentations such as the program initiation document.
 
Competencies: 
Critical Thinking: Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems
Active Learning: Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making
Business knowledge: Good understanding of the organization and the business domain or sector within which it operates
Complex Problem Solving: Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions
Deductive Reasoning: The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense
Inductive Reasoning: The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events)
Excellent communication skills: Ability to engage with high-level stakeholders, both verbal and non-verbal
Flexibility and adaptability (crucial to consulting environment)
Organizational and leadership abilities
Influencing and motivating
Decision making
Building trust and long-term relationships with stakeholders
For more information please contact:
Rene

Apply

Job Title:

Financial Advisor Assistant

Start Date:
2023-09-15 - 2023-10-15
Vacancy Type:
Permanent
RTB002274
Sectors:
Finance
Location:
North West, Potchefstroom
Salary:
R17 000 - R20 000 (13TH Cheque)
Brief:
Our client in the Potchefstroom area is looking for a Financial Advisor Assistant.
Detail:
Job description:
Your role as Financial Advisor Assistant will be to assist our financial advisors with all administrative functions necessary to perform their duties, including the preparation of various long term insurance and investment product quotations, liaison with clients and corresponding with various product providers.

Responsibilities:
(The responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following)

New Business Processing:
  • Responsible for the preparation of all new business quotations.
  • Ensure that the new business application forms are completed accurately and processed successfully.
  • Follow-up outstanding requirements with clients and sales support assist and ensure outstanding requirements are received timeously.
  • Capture notes on client management system and scan all relevant documentation onto the system for record keeping purposes.

Customer Services:
  • Coordination of all life insurance claims correspondence and follow-up of claims progress.
  • Record all client information on the customer management system.
  • Ensure all changes to customer details are communicated to and implemented by the appropriate fund managers.
  • Contribute towards the maintenance of existing customer relationships with the company.
  • Gather Policy information.
  • Ensure FAIS Compliance.

Qualifications:
Minimum requirements:
  • Matric
  • 5 years experience in the Long-Term Insurance and Unit Trust (Investment) Industry.
  • Adequate knowledge of Long-Term Insurance, Retirement Funds and Unit Trust Investment products.
Required skills/competencies:
  • Very good administrative skills.
  • Proficient in both spoken and written Afrikaans and English.
  • Computer literacy (MS Office).
  • Customer Service.
  • Communication skills (verbal and written).
  • Hard worker with integrity.
  • Able to work under pressure.
  • Problem-solver.
  • Attention to detail.
  • Team player.
For more information please contact:
Dianne

Job Title:

Construction Manager

Start Date:
2023-09-03 - 2023-10-03
Vacancy Type:
Contractor
RTB002265
Sectors:
Construction
Location:
Gauteng, Tshwane (Pretoria)
Salary:
R60 000 - R70 000 (Negotiable)
Brief:
As a Construction Manager with SACPCMP registration, you will play a pivotal role in managing construction projects from initiation to completion. Your responsibilities will encompass project planning, resource allocation, budget management, quality assurance, and ensuring strict adherence to safety standards. Your adept leadership skills will be invaluable in overseeing project teams and subcontractors, driving timelines, and maintaining clear communication with stakeholders
Detail:
Key Requirements
SACPCMP registration is a fundamental requirement.
Civil Engineering Qualification
Min 10 years demonstrated experience as a Construction Manager, ideally within roads and civil infrastructure projects.
Profound understanding of construction processes, project management methodologies, and safety regulations.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and leadership abilities.
Capacity to manage multiple projects concurrently and adapt to evolving project dynamics.
Proficiency in using project management software and tools.
 
Project Duration and Renewal:
This role is attached to a 12–18-month project, with the possibility of renewal contingent on upcoming projects. This presents an excellent opportunity for skilled professionals seeking stability and a chance to contribute to a variety of projects over an extended period.
For more information please contact:
Rene
